thread.title: Steve-O Will Go to Jail for His SeaWorld Protest Stunt
thread.title_full: Steve-O Will Go to Jail for His SeaWorld Protest Stunt

author: TV Guide
title: Steve-O Will Go to Jail for His SeaWorld Protest Stunt
text: 7:10 PM Updated at 10:40 PM   7:10 PM Updated at 10:40 PM Â» Social News Steve-O will be spending some time behind bars, but he has no regrets for what he did. The Jackass star posted on Instagram that he has been sentenced to 30 days in jail for a stunt he pulled in August to raise awareness for the treatment of animals at SeaWorld. OnAug. 9 he climbed to the top of a crane in Hollywood, carrying an inflatable whale and a sign protesting the theme park, and shot off fireworks. The stuntman posted the lengthy message, saying that he's "ready to go to jail - not just because it will bring so much attention to the plight of orcas in captivity, but because it's nice to let people know I haven't lost my edge...I mean, if your goal is to make a statement about captivity, you may as well get yourself locked up," he said, further highlighting his reformation by adding that he has also launched a campaign to raise funds for at-risk, inner city kids in Los Angeles. A photo posted by Steve-O (@officiallysteveo) on Oct 7, 2015 at 10:13am PDT Add new shows to your Watchlist now! In addition to his jail time, Steve-O was sentenced to 36 months of probation, ordered to pay $500 in fines and to stay out of the Hollywood Entertainment District. He pleaded no contest to two misdemeanor counts for fireworks and trespassing after originally being charged with one count each of creating a false emergency, use of unregistered fireworks, storing fireworks without a permit, possession of fireworks without a permit and trespassing. Steve-O will begin his jail sentence on Dec. 9, per The Hollywood Reporter . Watch Steve-O's video of the stunt: By TV Guide
